title: Trump Signs Executive Order To Revise ‘Horrible’ Rule, Rein In EPA
text:
Trump Invites Family Members Of Those Slain By Illegal Immigrants To Congress 
“The Clean Water Act says that the EPA can regulate navigable waters, meaning waters that truly affect interstate commerce. But a few years ago, the EPA decided that navigable waters can mean nearly every puddle or every ditch on a farmer’s land, or any place else that they decide,” Trump said. 
“It was a massive power grab. The EPA’s regulators are putting people out of jobs by the hundreds of thousands,” Trump added. Advertisement - story continues below 
Trump’s order does not overturn the rule, but it begins the process of rewriting it on the grounds that the Obama-era rule overstepped the federal government’s authority. The order also seeks to halt court cases involving the rule until a new rule can be drafted. 
The order follows Monday’s introduction of a resolution sponsored by Gibbs and 36 others urging that the rule be withdrawn. 
“Since the Obama Administration first proposed their … rule, I’ve heard from farmers, small business owners, county and township officials, and state environmental officials who have been strongly opposed” to the regulation, said Gibbs. 
“This resolution expresses just how important it is to rescind this EPA power grab and start from scratch, working with stakeholders to create a sensible rule that protects water quality and preserves the federal-state partnership of the Clean Water Act,” said Gibbs.
